application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out common law right and prune branches back to the shared boundary line One Oak, Woodland 23 TPO 1
decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.

The mature Oak tree is situated in the rear garden of the neighbouring property. It is in good condition and can be seen by all other neighbouring properties. For these reasons it has a high amenity value.

The requested amount to be removed will leave the tree unbalanced and potentially unable to recover. This will cause a total or high loss in amenity depending on if the tree survived with half a crown.
The application is refused due to the excessive amount requested to remove.
